If you do not agree to the Statement of use, you will be unable to receive filter recommendations, add location information in photo details, or add location watermarks to your photos. However, you can still use basic functions including taking photos and videos. To provide you with these basic functions, \"Camera\" requires the following permissions: use the camera (to take photos and videos), access storage data (to save photos and videos), and use the microphone (to record audio for videos). For details, refer to the %1$s.

\"Camera\" is an app that lets you take photos and videos. To provide services for you, it needs to obtain the following permissions: use the camera (to take photos and videos), access storage data (to save photos and videos), and use the microphone (to record audio for videos). You can also allow \"Camera\" to access the network and location information so you can receive filter recommendations, add location information in photo details, and add location watermarks to your photos. For details, refer to the %1$s.
Hold up your hand to the front camera take a photo.
Show palm to front camera to take a selfie.
After being turned on, the gradienter will only be displayed when the phone is close to be level.
Gyroscope is not working properly. Some camera features might be affected.

Take 10-bit photos in the \"Photo\" and \"Night\" mode using the rear camera. Photos will only be saved in HEIF format and they can only be displayed on a compatible device or app that supports 10-bit colour.

Take 10-bit photos in the \"Photo\" and \"Night\" modes using the rear camera. Photos will only be saved in the HEIF format and can only be displayed on a compatible device or app that supports 10-bit colour.

To reduce file size while retaining image quality, capture images in the high efficiency image format (HEIF). For apps that do not support HEIF, you can convert HEIF images to JPEG in the Photos app before viewing them.

To reduce file size while retaining image quality, capture photos in the high efficiency image format (HEIF). You can turn on \"Convert HEIF photos for sharing\" in \"Photos - Settings\" if the apps you are using to share photos do not support HEIF.
Record videos in high-efficiency video coding format (HEVC) to save space. You may not be able to play HEVC videos in some apps or operating systems or share them on social media.
Camera is unavailable until your phone cools down.
Your device needs to cool down before you can use the camera
Your device needs to cool down before you can use the flash

It takes more time to shoot in RAW+

RAW is a file format that contains unprocessed image data. It allows you to process the image to your liking. RAW+ can capture more details and a wider brightness range, and allows you greater freedom when editing.
Photographing takes longer than the exposure time to finish as multiple photos will be taken

\"Camera\" is an app that lets you take stunning photos and videos. To provide services for you, it needs to obtain the following permissions: access the network (to obtain location information and download stickers), use the camera (to take photos and videos), access storage data (to store photos and videos), and use the microphone and read phone state (to take videos). You can also allow \"Camera\" to obtain your location information so that it can add geotags or apply location watermarks to photos and videos. For details, refer to the %1$s.
\"Camera\" is an app that lets you take stunning photos and videos. For permissions that will be used by Camera, refer to the %1$s.

Tap on the frame to take a photo.
You can customise the speed, timer, and pro options.

Time-lapse photography is a shooting technique where things in a video appear to change faster than in reality.\nYour phone captures frames at regular intervals and combines them into a video. When taking time-lapse videos, the viewfinder shows the latest frame taken, and it may appear that nothing is happening until the next frame is taken and shown.
Too bright. Shoot in low light for best results.
Recording in progress. Unable to view it in \"Photos\".
You can set the total recording time here. The recording will end automatically when time is up. If the timer is set to \"Timer off\", you need to end the recording manually.
You can adjust the ISO, shutter speed, exposure compensation, focus, and white balance.
Shooting interval %s s, best for cars and pedestrians.
Shooting interval %s s, best for changing clouds.
Shooting interval %s s, best for blooming or withering flowers.
Shooting interval %s s, best for starry skies.
Shooting interval %s s, best for sunrise and sunset.
Shooting interval %s s, best for flowing water.

Speed indicates how many times longer the recording time is compared to the video length. It is related to the shooting interval. For example, when the speed is 15x, you will get 1 second of video for every 15 seconds you record. Videos are shot in 30 fps, which means 30 frames in 1 second of video. Therefore, at 15x, you have a shooting interval of 0.5 seconds.
Capture the bright, moving lights of vehicles at night and turn them into light trails.
Best for capturing the movement of the sun and clouds.

Common themes in time-lapse photography include urban scenes, natural scenes, astronomical events, and biological processes. \nYou can create professional-looking videos with the 3 pre-included templates: Light trails, Night sky, and Sun & clouds.
Record the night sky in an open area free of light pollution for about an hour to capture the movement of the stars.
Speed: 10x\nBest for moving vehicles and pedestrians

By tapping \"Agree\", you agree to the above content.
Focus mode. Switch to MF to manually adjust the focus or switch to AF to have it adjusted automatically for you.
Exposure compensation allows you to adjust the exposure selected by the camera. Increase the exposure if the image is too dark, or decrease it if the image is too bright.

The camera\'s sensitivity to light. By increasing the ISO sensitivity, you can improve the photo effects in low light. A higher ISO value produces brighter photos with more noise, while a lower ISO value produces darker photos with less noise.
Shutter speed controls how long your camera\'s sensor is exposed to light. For best results in low light, use a slower shutter speed and hold your phone steady until the shot is complete.
Adjust the white balance value to bring the colour temperature back to neutral. Use a higher value to produce a warmer image, or a lower one for a cooler image.
Swipe up on the thumbnail image in the lower-left corner to show sharing and editing options.
Display shortcuts to share and edit the photo or video you just took.
Rear camera obstructed. Fold down the lighting kit to continue.
The upgrade package was downloaded without consuming cellular data. Install it now.
You\'re using the cellular network. App updates will consume mobile data.
When taking photos of pets, food, and other similar subjects, you can make it look like the camera is moving around the subject in a circular motion.
Classic Hitchcock zoom. When taking photos with a strong sense of depth, you can make it look as if the background is moving farther away from the subject.
With Arc, you can generate an arc shot as if the camera were moving around the human subject.
Add an effect that makes it look like the camera is swaying from side-to-side as it zooms toward your subject.
